description: Presented by James Oroc.  This workshop builds on the discoveries and theories on a quantum role for the entheogenic experience that I presented in my book "Tryptamine Palace: 5-MeO-DMT and the Sonoran Desert Toad", by integrating ancient and modern ideas on the role of the Ego in consciousness. We will examine how entheogen use can cast a light on some of the most ancient and perplexing questions of the role of the Ego in our lives; and how the Ego creates our Society and technology, and how our modern view of the role of the Ego - in both our lives and our Society - will shape the future we will all live.

description:
This workshop, now in its 8th year on the playa, is an ultra-condensed form of a type of massage developed by the Body Electric School. It combines breathwork and a sequence of erotic massage techniques which stimulate erotic energy but don’t expend it in ejaculation. The result is often a heightened erotic state some people call a “full body orgasm,” which can go on for many minutes and can lead to all kinds of ecstasies, insights, and even spiritual experiences.  

Here are a few guiding principles if you’re thinking of coming to the workshop (more at http://playajoy.org/?p=2758#more-2758):

- Yes, participants get naked and give/receive erotic, genital massage.  So, this is only open to adults, and only participants – no spectators.

- Givers of massage may be of any sex, receivers must have a penis. (One of the most powerful parts of this workshop is how gay, straight, & everyone else share erotic space together.)

- You can come with a partner or try your luck at the workshop. Usually, about a dozen people come partnerless to each workshop.

- There is no contact between participants other than the massage. This isn’t group sex (not that there's anything wrong with that!) Boundaries are maintained and respected. We even ask that givers not look around the room — receivers can feel it when you’re not tuned in.

- Bring water, a towel and WetOnes for optimal pleasure. Pee ahead of time. Some people like to be blindfolded – bring a bandana or blindfold if you like.  Bring breath mints to gift to others!

- Last year we had a line around the block a full hour before the workshop started. So, come early!

- Unfortunately, we don’t have time to do two full workshops, so you’ll either give or receive, but not both. Both are hot!

See you on the playa!
print_description: Breathwork & erotic massage for men & their lovers, as taught by Body Electric. Hands on, clothes off, full body orgasm! Adult participants only.
title: Erotic Massage for Men & their Lovers

description:
An Eyedyllic retreat for soothing astonished eyes and dust weary feet.  We will provide a sanctuary to relax in, while your peepers and your creepers are being attended to by "doctors" without orders.
The goal of Eyeland Oasis is to provide a tranquil oasis for fellow Burners to receive soothing care for their red, dusty eyes (organic chilled cucumber slices on the eyelids, chilled gel eye masks, herbal/saline eyedrops for self-application) and for their weary, under-appreciated feet (foot bath with a vinegar formula, massage and moisturizer application), while relaxing in reclining chairs or futons, listening to soft ambient music and wind chimes, and drinking lemon-slice-infused chilled water.  We will have an aesthetic and luxurious "spa" inside a 30' diameter shade tent with attractive/flowing fabrics and carpets and creative, entertaining graphics designed by several of our professional artist campmates.  We will be able to accommodate up to 6 "patients" at a time and will have 4 attendants on site during the afternoon hours. We will also gift eye cups decorated with an Eyeland Oasis/BMan logo.  We plan to bring 2, 55-gallon water containers, and will build an appro!
priate gray water/evap area.
To soften borders, open hearts, open arms and open eyes.
Enjoy the creativity of others' minds.
As adults, to remind people how to be playful.
To see and appreciate imagination become reality.
To continue to influence the macrocosm and microcosm of our worlds thru the BMan experience with our creativity and life choices throughout the year.
print_description: An Eyedyllic retreat for soothing astonished eyes and dust weary feet.  We will provide a sanctuary for your relaxation.
title: Eyeland Oasis

description:
Due to the extra traffic of our bourgeoning population pouring into the playa, the dust is expected to be much worse this year, so much so that they’re calling it Futility 2.0. Even the Black Rock Rangers have faltered as their ranks have questioned their resolve in the face of such a menace. They need not fear, for The French Maid Brigade will once again provide their services gratis to the community of Black Rock City. Once again our citizens can rest assured that they will be protected from any and all dusty intrusions. 

Each year one or two rookie French Maids spend extra time addressing the situation with the Rangers only to realize, “Wait, they actually dress to look like dust!” Indeed, if you could magnify a dust particle five billion times, you would see the likeness of a Black Rock Ranger. Clearly the Rangers have succumbed to the mentality of “If you can’t beat ‘em, join ‘em." The French Maids have no such intentions with dust, will never surrender, and continue to support the radical self-expression of all who dwell on the playa through maintaining a dust-free environment for all who participate.

Many enquiries are made every year as to how one might join such a venerable organization. You too can be one of the sexiest clean freaks on the playa. Stop by our camp anytime for official recruitment or rendezvous with us on the playa. Please bring: non-feather dusters, rags, dustbusters, service carts, vacuums, white gloves, latex gloves, enema kits, lube, any other useful cleaning equipment, and your worst possible French accent. On Thursday at 2:00 pm we meet at 3 O’Clock and Esplanade then dust our way through every filthy, nasty camp on our march toward that dust bucket known as Center Camp Café, liberate them from their dusty oppression, and celebrate our triumph!
print_description: Dust abatement doesn't have to be Futility 2.0. Join us in uniform with your non-feather duster and your worst possible French accent.
title: French Maid Brigade Parade

I am excited to share the knowledge and artistry of eating and living an Activated lifestyle.  This will be my sixth burn, and fourth year teaching and sharing my passion and love for Fermentation.  Each year we have had a huge turnout, so come early to get a good seat, and bring something to sit on if you can.    

In this workshop I will share background, history, benefits, and instructions for how you can incorporate fermented and activated foods into your life.  
There will also be a variety of fermented food & drink samples to stimulate your palate, and awaken your body to the magic of these healing foods.  

After the workshop is over, everyone is invited to stay and share a variety of fermented foods and drinks.  Participants are encouraged to bring items to share with others.
print_description: 4th year back by popular demand: Learn, taste, and get activated by this fun workshop focusing on the ancient art of fermentation. Followed by potluck
title: Fun with Fermentation Workshop

description:
At the Ultimate Fuzzy Celebration camp we LOVE cuddling.

We love it so much that we built a "cuddling oasis" - a space where one can take a break, chill, relax, and snuggle - with loved ones or complete strangers - at all times of day or night.

Dubbed the Cuddle Dome, our cuddling space offers a plethora of implements to maximize you comfort and cuddling awesomeness.

Cuddling awesomeness, say you? Who wouldn't want to cuddle suspended 10 feet in the air under the starry Playa sky? (yes, we have a Sky Loft)

And of course we have pillows and blankets. Lots of 'em!

---------------------
Wear your comfiest outfit - fur if you have - and join us for some relaxation, nurture, and affectionate touch before you hit the nighttime playa tonight.
print_description: Love to cuddle? Wear your comfiest (furry!) outfit and join us for some relaxation and affectionate touch before you hit the nighttime playa tonight.
title: Fuzzy Cuddle Party

description:
The Journey - Life Cycle Evolution
The first blurry ebbs & flows of life in protective space, growing with the beat of our initial life source. Painfully but beautifully, our space transforms & we enter the world. A tremendous, grounding grandeur marks our arrival & the rhythm of life begins. As we seek expression, understanding & movement, we drift in an emotional but transient phase & succumb to the flow of life. Eventually we discover our 'voice' & finding contentment in the language of music, our simultaneous sameness & uniqueness is revealed. Seeking transcendence, we push the boundaries of experience, towards the inevitable & incredible transformation which marks the often sombre, but ultimately celebratory end/beginning.
print_description: The Journey - Life Cycle Evolution: The first blurry ebbs & flows of life in protective space, growing with the beat of our initial life source.
title: Gabriel Gilmore

description: An alchemical food and drink spot, Gastronomae Dominae will feature molecular gastronomy, and magic, often indistinguishable. Stop by and taste ritualistically constructed gastronomical feats of food and drink that will tease and taunt your tongue. This low key lounge with hookah, incense, cool drinks, and lots of pillows to lay on is a retreat from the heat of the day, a place to stop by and relax, and try something new. Come experience a sense of haven, and distance from the world around us, using unique textures and tastes to transport yourself to a new world.
print_description: Molecular gastronomy, hookah, absinthe, and lounging in the shade!  Oh, and spicy snow cones.  Because we can!
title: Gastronomae Dominae

description: Black Rock City's LGBT community kicks off the week in festive rainbow colors with libations, music and an exchange of info on the week's gay-oriented events. This premier annual gathering for the Playa's Gay/Bi/Curious Burners and their friends moves to Down Low Club Camp @ 7:45 Edelweiss this year in memory of Mario Cisneros, founder of the event and the former Moonbow Camp. Come meet new friends, reaquaint with those from past Burns, perhaps spark a new Playa romance or rekindle one from the past. Gather with your LGBT brothers and sisters to learn where they are camped and what events they've got planned for the week on the Playa. Don't forget to bring a flyer or other info about your gay-oriented events to post on our LGBT Community Bulletin Board.
print_description: Hosted by Down Low Club @ 7:45 Edelweiss, BRC's LGBT community kicks off the week w/libations, music & info exchange on the week's gay-oriented events
title: Gay Meet & Greet

description:
Burning Geeks.  

This is the official info on this years Playa-side Geek-n-Greet.   

All Burning Geeks are invited to join us in celebrating your year round hard work keeping our interwebs interwebbable!

If you've been rock-starring it across our virtual highways or orbiting events from a cloaked vessel, please come and join us for a stark ravingly fun evening!

WHEN? 
WEDNESDAY, starting at 7ish

WHERE? 
EGGS bar 2012 at 1:30 on the Inner Circle

WHO? 
Web Team, SysAdmin Team, Year-round-Staff Geeks, Playa Wifi Team, BRC Staff Geeks and Friends!

SOUNDS? 
Our very own Kevin aka Dwell will be backing us up with a themed mix! And probably others... 

THEME? 
TBD, and no, the theme is not TBD. The theme is still to be decided. 

WHAT? 
Cocktails and geek speak and more.

LOVE FROM THE PLAYA AND THANK YOU FOR MAKING IT HAPPEN!

description:
Geocaching is back in Black Rock City for 2012!  This is an official Geocaching event to add to your log.  A Geocaching poster will be hanging in the Info area near Center Camp announcing the exact waypoints of Geo Dust II Headquarters.  

In order to get credit for this cache, you must participate in the gift exchange/martini happy hour or post a picture of yourself next to any one of the daily hides (See Repeating Events).  

What to Bring:

1) micro/small-sized wrapped exchange gift, value = sentimental (suggestion: piece of Burning Man/BRC swag from a prior year or Geocaching swag)

description:
"Global Soul" is bringing the higher vibe to Sacred Spaces Village every night, Tuesday-Friday, from 7-10 p.m.!  Featuring a groovalicious fusion of rhythms, harmonies, melodies, movement and magic inspired by cultures from around the world, Global Soul is a soul-stirring, hip-shaking and heart-opening musical feast! 

First, join Soul Songstress Janis Kelly, Percussion Priestess Cheri Shanti and Dance Diva Ahva Lenay, as they move you, groove you and behoove you to bring your inner musician out to play!  Then, get ready for LIVE funk, r&b, jazz, reggae, Salsa, samba, Afro-pop/soul, and other world-infused dance music guaranteed to invite, incite and ignite your own global soul experience!

-WEDNESDAY NIGHT: Africa/Caribbean including Afrobeat, Afro-Pop, High Life and Reggae.  7-7:30--Global Soul "Jam" with Janis, Cheri & Ahva; 7:30-8:00--Global Soul Experience LIVE; 8:00-10:00--Issy Wise & Friends LIVE
print_description: "Global Soul" is a nightly, groovalicious throw-down of LIVE music, movement and magic from around the world! Let us invite/incite/ignite your night!
title: "Global Soul" Throwdown: Africa/Caribbean

description:
The goat will burn. You will drink from its udders and be purified. Don't forget to slap the goat.

Only certain VIPs welcome and respected. Prerequisites exist. A return or an exchange for something of equal value is needed (recommended $40-$80 at gate). Our commercial sponsorship is via Krug.  The shaman priest rabbi pastor determines the content of the collaborating group; no self expression allowed. We strive to produce, promote and protect the Bumblepuss, Nectar community as the antithesis of Burning Man.  We value civil society; not the individual.  If you come, you cannot participate.  You can only observe unless you helped build it, and still, it is still unlikely you will be allowed to participate in the ceremony.  VIP tables with goat buckeyes, goat cheese spread, goat innards, and prime seating are $1200 per table (bring binoculars and a sniper rifle).  (Reservations are a necessity).
print_description: The goat will burn. You will drink from its udders and be purified. Don't forget to slap the goat. Reservations are a necessity. Bring staff + poi.
title: GOAT SLAPPING

description: No kidding - 2012 really is the 10TH YEAR of the Golden Cafe on playa!To celebrate, there will be a party all day and all night. You heard right, the Golden Cafe, the most quaint little daytime bar at Burning Man, will be open for one solid night, with all that entails...fire spinning...black light...glowing drinks...mutant vehicles...live bands...DJs...stilt walkers...burlesque...dancing in the streets...We aim to make it EPIC and CRAZY, the way Burners partied back in 2003, and WE NEED YOUR HELP. From Wednesday morning to Thursday morning, wave after wave of camps are invited to join the bedlam wearing their colors, for a special appropriate treat. Let us know how you want to participate and what we can do to lend a hand - we're up for whatever it takes to make the event so ridiculous that it parts the heavens...www.goldencafe.org
print_description: 2012 really is the 10TH YEAR of the swankest cocktail lounge on playa! Flaming drinks! Layered drinks! Communal drinks! Bring something to share!

description: Glass Camp is a highly interactive project. Glass blowing is a mesmerizing art in itself. While it’s an art form dating backing to the birth of humanity, it’s still relatively new in the United States. The glow of a molten, honey-like material at night is hypnotic. The radiant heat of the equipment illuminating the hot shop floor is an installation in itself. Glass is a dance, with each team developing its own choreography. We intend to include the audience with ‘You Name It, We Make It’ activities. People can submit a design and our collection of talented artists will assemble what was not thought possible. Our team consists of some of the most skilled emerging and established artists in Seattle, the mecca for glass working in the world. Each night the team will take at least 2 complex designs from the audience and take the 2-D drawing and pull the 3-D design from the hot glass. There is no limit to what can be achieved in glass, and that’s what we intend to show. Glass blowing began in the Fertile Crescent and we hope to take it to Fertility 2.0. These professional artists are encyclopedias of information to anything relating to glass and high temperatures. With the making of glass, questions always arise, and we are equipped with the information to help people understand. All of our equipment was handmade by Evan Schuass, and was used last year in the Keyhole. Mobile glass studios are an excellent display of design, function, and efficiently. He has been commissioned from people all over the West Coast, and Hawaii to build these mobile shops. All the people included in Glass Camp are either producing artists or assistants to the highest level of glass workers in the world. We would like to share our gift and knowledge with the people of Burning Man. Everyone in this camp is here because they have a passion for glass art.

description:
Yogi Prateado travels the noosphere with the Hang, percussion, electronics, and other devices to woo harmonious realization.

The Hang, a U.F.O. looking instrument, was created in 2000, by Felix and Sabina, the Hang makers, in Bern, Switzerland. This remarkable instrument sounds like the celestial orbs, a harp, or what have you. As the primary instrument of sonic creation for Prateado, collaboration with some of the top live and electronic artists on the west coast bring an array of listening and movement experiences.

description:
In order to fight the threat of food-borne illness on the playa, the Nevada State Health Division (NSHD) has requirements for camps preparing food including the need of a health permit and an inspection. You must apply for and be permitted as a Temporary Food Establishment by the NSHD if:

* You will be cooking or serving food to large groups of more than 125* FELLOW CAMPERS of your theme camp on a consistent basis.

(If you have a communal kitchen shared by 125 or more campers, but meals are prepared individually, or in smaller quantities than for 125 persons, a permit is not required, however we highly recommend you research and review safe food handling practices, starting with the Nevada Division of Health information).

* You wish to share, cook or serve food or non-alcoholic beverages to the general Burning Man population (gifting food).

Here are the permit procedures and deadlines:

If you have already applied for a permit, you should be receiving instructions in the mail soon.

If you are planning to make and give away food or drinks to the public on the playa including fresh squeezed juice, coffee with dairy, or even snow cones, you need a permit. Here's the scoop from Cindy Ulch, Supervisor with the Nevada State Health Divisions Public Health and Clinical Services Environmental Health Program:

The only application any camp needs is the "Food Permit Application for Burning Man" found here:
http://health.nv.gov/BFHS_EHS.htm 

Don't wait until the last minute. It would be a shame to have to cancel your plans, or even risk being closed at the event.  That mailing address is  NSHD - PHCS 475 West Haskell Street Suite 38, Winnemucca, NV 89445.

In person:  No later than THURSDAY AUGUST 23rd - 4150 Technology Way Suite 100, Carson City, NV.  Phone: (775) 687-7550 or 475 West Haskell Street Suite 38 Winnemucca, NV.  Phone (775) 623-6588.
print_description: Feeding 125+? Pick up your pre-ordered Nevada State Health Division food safety permit and schedule your safety inspection: Sun 8/26 - Sat 9/1.
title: Health Permit pick up & inspection reservations

description:
The boys of Homojitoville invite you to our fabulous happy hour! Stop by camp at 8:45 & Edelweiss, facing the Man. Or find us dancing & serving icy fresh Homojitos from the fabulously appointed Mobile Homojito Dance Bar randomly in Deep Playa. Bring us your cup, we'll fill it with love!  Wednesday @ 5:00pm - 7:00pm

We will be hosting a few spontaneous cocktail hours at Homojitoville as well as at our Honorarium Art Installation "MURMURATION" and random deep playa excursions throughout the week!  Feel free to stop by camp, say hi, enjoy an icey fresh Homojito and dance below the bright puffy flowers of the Sound Garden of Eden!  

Bringing Spontaneity back to the Playa!A mirage appears in deep Playa. The aroma of fresh icy homojitos stimulates your hypothalamus. Giant bright puffy flowers belt out groovy dance beats. Leave it to serendipity and the boys of Homojitoville! Always on the move, the Mobile Homojito Dance Bar and Sound Garden of Eden appears randomly, erupting in a fabulous cocktail and dance party, then disappears. Never in the same place twice, this is no mirage. Shake your groove thing where spontaneity rules! Bring us your cup, we’ll fill it with love.

Homojitoville Facebook Page; 
https://www.facebook.com/?ref=tn_tnmn#!/pages/HomojitoVille/146746548673607

Dusty Hugs!
-The Boys of Homojitoville

description:
Polyamory can open up a whole new world of dating possibilities.  For the introverted and shy however, it can open up a whole new world of dating nightmares.  In this workshop we will tackle some of the challenges of entering, or re-entering the dating field, handling dating roles and imbalances.  Finding and embracing your local poly community, dealing with social awkwardness and embrace your awesome self.

We will have a few speakers who can share their experiences, perspectives and stories on how they have been able to balance being introverted, and meeting new people in the Polyamory community.

description: Mamawitz from Children of Chaos will be hosting her Jewish Mother booth again this year, dispensing advice and nurturing for all. “The Jewish Mother You Never Had” will be available 11-noon Tuesday-Friday and Mom's hours will also be posted in front of the camp. Mamawitz will be providing delicious cookies, milk, (maybe even a bagel!) and lots of love and caring for Burners requiring a little TLC - in English, Hebrew, French, and/or Spanish. The 2009 version of this event won the Acculturation Video award from Burning Man (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dtX8Z-izffs\). As Mamawitz says, "everyone needs motherly advice, but who wants to hear it from their own mother?...oy, too much baggage!" Come visit with Burning Man's very own Jewish Mother who dispenses love, nurturing, advice and no guilt (unless absolutely necessary).

description:
In Samoa, kava (called 'ava) is drunk at all important gatherings and ceremonies. The kava is prepared by a group of people called aumaga. It is brought to each participant by the tautua'ava, or 'ava server, in the order proscribed by the tufa'ava, or 'ava distributor. Usually, the highest chief of the visiting party is served first, followed by the highest chief of the host party, and then service proceeds based on the rank of the rest of the participants. The drink is served in a polished coconut half. The overall ceremony is highly ritualized, with specific gestures and phrases to be used at various times.

Our Kava ceremony will be a first come first serve event if the turnout is too overwhelming! Hope to see you there!

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samoa_%27ava_ceremony
print_description: Join Green SOL for a Samoan style Kava ceremony to celebrate gathering in BRC! It is recommended to fast 3 hours prior to the ceremony. NO ALCOHOL!!
title: Kava Ceremony

description:
Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul in connection with your breath and movement during this yoga class. Be inspired and take your body to a higher self-awareness by joining me in a traditional Kundalini Yoga warm-up and introductory set/kriya. If you are already experienced in yoga, you can incorporate longer time and more intense movement into the exercises, and benefit from realizing and stretching the boundaries of your physical abilities. 
Come to this class at least 90 minutes after eating a meal, in comfortable clothing that will allow for a full range of movement. Bring a healthy snack with you to enjoy after the class. Bring a water bottle you can fill it at the Pink Heart water bar, or your own favorite hydration to enjoy during the class. Yoga mat not necessary, but recommended.
print_description: Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul in connection with your breath and movement during this yoga class.

description: Try on Laughter Yoga to get your Xi flowing like the Playa breeze is blowing! You’ll work up a healthy appetite for whatever your evening activities may be. Start your evenings with the most intense laughter you can experience. We laugh for no reason, other than for exercise, and health. Relieve stress and pain, promote natural healing, and create spontaneous bonds of friendship through laughter. It’s fun! The brainchild of Dr. Madan Kataria in India and practiced by millions worldwide, Laughter Yoga combines Unconditional Laughter with Yogic Breathing (Pranayama). Anyone can Laugh for No Reason, without relying on humor, jokes or comedy. Laughter is simulated as a body exercise in a group; with eye contact and childlike playfulness, it soon turns into real and contagious laughter. The concept of Laughter Yoga is based on a scientific fact that the body cannot differentiate between fake and real laughter. One gets the same physiological and psychological benefits. Find much more info online by searching on Laughter Yoga, but come! Enjoy!
print_description: Laughter as exercise! Laugh with others in childlike playfulness and experience all the health benefits of a good long laugh! The Xi flowing so free!
title: Laughter Yoga

description: This class is an introduction into the various toys and equipment used in dungeon play. We will discuss the proper use and safety aspects in using the equipment, as well as, the importance of partner trust and safe words. The class will focus on the softer more sensual side and partnership interaction of dungeon play. Volunteers will be asked to participate in the demonstrations and all are welcome to stay afterwards to experiment and experience dungeon play. We offer a well equipped dungeon with a St Andrews cross, a seated cross, various benches, tables, a suspension area, an 8 foot chain web,in an open and semi private play areas and various types of floggers, paddles, canes, pinwheels, feathers, violet wands, fire play, and more. To ensure your safety,  all play will be supervised and we are available to provide instruction on the proper use of the equipment and can assist with fascilitating your experience. Singles, couples and groups are all welcome.
print_description: An intro of various toys and equipment and their safe use during dungeon play with focus on the softer more sensual side. Stay and play afterwards.
title: Learn the more sensual and softer side of dungeon

description: I became interested in how the shamans utilized sound, chant and music to guide and affect trance states as well as healing. I practiced as a healer at our center (www.bluemorphotours.com), specializing in using ayahuasca and sound to heal depression and generate transcendent experience of consciousness. http://www.nationalgeographic.com/adventure/0603/features/peru.html 4 years ago I started to branch out from ayahuasca and sought to bring the unique qualities of ayahuasca shamanism to music. I wanted to use the music to guide trance states induced by the music. The theory was to guide people to heart, love and direct spiritual or transcendent experience without being told where or how to go. The music itself would guide through the mix of sounds. I started a music partnership with my wife Wendy, who is a 15 year opera, choir and rock singer to create the music. The mix of her traditional musical training with my traditional shamanic training allowed for the right combination to make the music possible.We blended the musical structure found in the shamanism to existing electronic genres like World Music and House. The music itself is electronic with vocals sung by Wendy and me.As for the burn, we have three distinct types of music we could perform. The first would be the chants and icaros of traditional amazonian shamanism (leading ceremonies for groups of people), the second would be to perform our world music and the third, our house music. In addition, lectures on ayahuasca shamanism and the traditional uses of ayahuasca, how it is practiced, apprenticeship, working with elders and the modern uses of ayahuasca for healing.  In addition I created a project called Modern Shamanism designed to create a unique form of shamanic/spiritual exploration for Modern people based out of modern life experience. I could lead trances/meditations through this practice. www.modernshamanism.org
print_description: I have studied and practiced traditional amazonian shamanism (with a focus in Ayahuasca, tree, and sanango shamanism in the Peruvian Amazon)
title: Lecture Traditional and Modern Amazonian Shamanism

description: About the fourth day of Burning Man - 2012, God got a little bored.  Being all knowing and all seeing, he already had had his Wednesday melt down of too much dust and sun, and needed a pick Him up.  He’d taken a liking to Camp Brand Ur Ass, and its Houston contingent, the Rubber Chicken Camp - because Rubber Chickens are inherently funny; almost as funny as giraffes.  Anywho, He gave them the idea a couple of years ago to host a Lemon Heaven party - (omnipotent, remember? Sort of like Doctor Who, but without the TARDIS) and knew they’d picked up some lemons, vodka (for those of you wary of mixing), and some powdered lemon stuff, and said, “Yea, verily, thou shalt host another LEMON HEAVEN PARTY!” That was in his most impressive god voice.  He also knew they played excellent, party dance music. So, everyone who’s anyone, please join the Rubber Chicken Camp, at Camp Brand Ur Ass, on Thursday evening around 7-ish.

description: Our 5th year on the playa and a very popular daytime destination enjoyed by all who find us. Each year, we do nothing more than create a fun jungle-vibe space where you can get your feet (and body should you desire) rubbed, and share a shot of tequila with us. The Leopard Lounge runs on the kindness of strangers, so we also welcome you to join our staff and participate in the gifting of a footrub or massage, just be sure to do so with respect to personal boundaries. If you have other gifts to share: food, musical talent, energy work, manicure/pedicure, hair braiding, readings, etc., the Leopard Lounge is a great place to park yourself and offer your services. No scheduling or expectations, just gratitude for however long you want to contribute. The vibe is all things Jungle, Safari, Animal, so dress the part if you can!

description: Yoga with Live Music...what a beautiful combination to start your day in Black Rock City.   Join us each morning, Tuesday through Thursday, as our highly trained yoga teachers, accompanied by professional live musicians, take your body, mind, and soul through a unique journey of exploration, rejuvenation, and musical elevation.  Located inside our very spacious, 2400 sq. ft. Embassy Shade Structure, with its woven flooring and cool breezeways...we suggest that you arrive early to reserve your favorite space.  2012 teachers include: Buckman Coe, Mangala, Bless Leone, and Meha.

description:
Real, live music from kick ass rockers. Thursday-Saturday, 4-7P & 9P-12A. "Life is too damn short for crappy music."  Come dance your ass off with Greg and Doug, the organic jukebox duo from the Great White North.  These guys know rock: with a mental catalogue of over 3,000 tracks, they can move the crowd like Jagger.

Star Star Roadhouse is a destination… a local joint for wayward Burners looking for something different.  Here you can catch a live show: classic rock, moody blues or bluegrass… a rare experience at Burning Man. The sound system will be modest: what you'd expect to find at a honky tonk venue with live music.  Shows will be twice daily from 4-7, and 9-midnight, with an occasional after hours exception. We will be collaborating with many promoters on playa to book a variety of live bands. Yoga & dance classes will also be offered.

The stage will be decked out in classic Americana and vintage California-Nevada highway stylings, with colorful lighting, a sun bleached facade, shaded dance floor and lounge area with comfortable seating. Billiards and darts provide additional play and other interactive games are in the plans.

For added excitement and a visually stunning art experience, Artist Jamie Vaida & Crew are building the Fertility Twin mutant vehicles with indirect LED lighting, flame effects, and audio. They will either be parked near the stage or out rocking the playa with classic tunes transporting participants physically and musically.

We believe that the live music experience is unique and often absent at Burning Man and “Star Star Roadhouse” would be thrilled to offer it to the community.

hosted_by_camp.name: Star Star Roadhouse @ Black Star Village

matched_name: Star Star Roadhouse @ Black Star Village
print_description: Real, live music from kick ass rockers. Dance your ass off Thursday-Saturday, 4-7P & 9P-12A. "Life is too damn short for crappy music!" 8:30 & E
title: LIVE ROCK MUSIC

description: In the world of electronic dance music, few artists transcend genre with as unique and epic a style as LOGOS. Composer and producer Jim Genaro weaves together a rich tapestry of sounds, drawing influences from psychedelic trance and house music, but also from industrial, world beat, progressive rock, and even classical roots. LOGOS takes the energy and sounds of the dance floor and layers them with complex harmonies and melodies that send the listener on a journey into new sonic dimensions.

description: The sun’s just up, but not too hot yet. Come for an early hour of low impact exercise in the Longevity Stick Art (LSA) discipline of 12 low-impact exercises to build balance, flexibility, strength, mental focus, breathing capacity, and vitality, and open your points and channels. Bring your water or hydration liquid. We’ll have sticks available for you. Master Mai Bac Dao developed the Longevity Stick Art discipline while he was a prisoner of war of the North Vietnamese Army. He helped his fellow prisoners restore and maintain their health through LSA, and vowed that if he was ever freed, he would dedicate his life to spreading its benefits to the world, with the proviso that no future trainer could ever charge for the course. (Sounds like "gifting," eh?) He was freed, settled in Southern California, and started teaching classes of students and future teachers. Today, there are dozens of classes weekly around So Cal. Also, LSA is spreading around the US and world. Many more details are available at: www.longevitystick.org/Longevitystick.org/Home.html and www.filmbaby.com/films/2341 Master Dao passed away late 2010 at age 89, and one of our campers was privileged to attend his funeral, and his last birthday party, a few months before.
print_description: The sun’s just up, but not too hot yet. It’s 1 early hour of lo impact exercise to build balance and open points & channels. Bring H2O. We got sticks!
title: Longevity Stick Art

description:
A 'Merkin' pageant for both ladies and gents.  The ladies pageant will be entitled "Annie's Fannies"  and the gents "Gerkin Merkins".


The pageant will be open for entrants from both the Public and camp members.  An appropriate prize will be awarded for the winner in each pageant.


Each pageant will be judged by a panel of 4 camp members, 2 gents and 2 ladies.  The same panel will judge each pageant. On the grounds of impartiality the camp members chosen to judge will not be allowed to enter the pageant.


Each panel member can award points on a scale of 1-10 for:


Design, Implementation, Originality, Mooplessness. 


In the event of a tie we ask the audience to cheer for their choice and the entrant with the loudest cheer will win.


During the event our bar will offer two speciality drinks.  The combination of some of the finest beer and lemonade will be sold as 'Annie's Hand Shandy'.   A suitable cocktail will be concocted and sold as 'Annie's Merkin Mix'.
print_description: A 'Merkin' pageant for both ladies and gents.  The ladies pageant will be entitled "Annie's Fannies"  and the gents "Gerkin Merkins".
title: Merkin Pageant

description:
Our goal for this "Miso soup camp" is to prevent electrolyte imbalance for Burners. 
According to wikipedia, Pure miso paste nutritional information: Although high in sodium (over 400% DV), one cup (275 g) of miso paste is an excellent source of dietary fiber (59%) and protein (64% DV), as well as a good source of minerals . Miso paste is also high in amino acids, the basic building blocks of protein. An excellent source of vitamin K and a decent source of riboflavin (38% DV), miso also provides small amounts of other vitamins. One major benefit of miso is its extremely high omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acid content.
We believe Miso saves Burners life on the Playa and leave them with good health all day.
print_description:
Come and have fabulous morning Miso soup with us.
Made by Japanese team. :)
title: Miso Soup

description: 1worldcurrency.net will be hosting a currency creation workshop at Shwar Town camp located @ 8:30 and D in the Shamans story Tipi. Messenger Joshua tells of the serpent viper money changers concealing the truth that "Money Grows on Trees"  It was the secret lost in the Garden of Eden that we now remember. Learn the truth about money, how to end usury and deliver the gifting economy to the default world. All tribes unite as we co-create a resource based currency, grown organically out of the ground. Learn of the ancient granary receipt and how it can free any agricultural community from FIAT currency. Learn of "unity through currency", and how we can eat nuclear submarines for snack time. Dragons, serpents and those who sold their souls to the front of the line.

description:
Each year since 2004, hundreds of naked burners meet at the Man to consume a little liquid courage, and pedal off into the City for a few hours of bar hopping.  Six host camps will have bartenders standing by with icy libations prepared exclusively for the ride participants.  We’ll be stopping off at Barbie Death Camp & Wine Bistro, Celestial Bodies, Camp Swede, and the Tiki Bar.  How many naked cyclists can we squeeze into a tiki bar?  Come help us break last year’s record.  We’ll also be hitting Duckpond for keg beer and some slip-’n-slide action.  As always, the famous naked bartenders of Comfort & Joy will be hosting the after party.  This ride isn’t just an event, it’s a tradition.  So if you’re willing to meet the dress code, join us for one of the silliest parties on the playa.  Trust us, after the first couple of cocktails you won’t mind being naked. 

If you're interested in helping to steward the ride, contact us at dunneasley@hotmail.com.  We can always use more rider wranglers.
print_description: Six camps will be standing by with icy cocktails. It's like Critical Mass with alcohol and blatant public nudity. 350 mugs for the early arrivers.
title: Naked Pub Crawl

Going up, down and all around, have a ball rolling over the Playa strapped inside our giant, inflatable ball. Take a turn pushing and then be pushed. It’s a wild ride. You don’t have to take your clothes off to have a good time, but you do if you want to ride the ZORB. Meet us on the Playa. We start near 7:00 and Esplanade and end up where we roll. You will recognize our big ball

description: What is Buddhahood? Is it just for Shakyamuni? Is it just for monks removed from day to day life? Do you have to sell all your worldly possessions? Nope. The potential for Buddhahood exists within everyone in their current form. All we need is the tool to call it out from within and experience a state of unshakeable happiness and compassion. Come join us for a discussion about a Buddhist practice that opens the door for anyone to attain this supreme state of life.
print_description: The potential for Buddhahood exists within everyone just as they are. Join us for a discussion about how to reveal this life state from within.
title: On Attaining Buddhahood in this Lifetime

description:
Since 2003, Palenque Norte has been the Burning Man reincarnation of the legendary Entheobotany Conferences held near the ancient Mayan temples near Palenque, Mexico. There, Terence McKenna, Jonathan Ott, Ann & Sasha Shulgin, and a host of other luminaries held forth. This year we are featuring many visionary talks, community circles, art and performances on subjects such as: the psychedelic experience and research, technological transformation of the human condition and far future, the weird and the strange, and healing plant medicines. 

Bruce Damer, Annie Oak, Robert Forte and many others (TBA) will be joining us for three afternoons of lively sessions which will be held in The Crystal Cavern at Camp Above the Limit. Our schedules are posted daily.

As is our tradition, all sessions will be later broadcast in the Psychedelic Salon podcast.
print_description: Visionary talks and discussion, community circles & art: consciousness, psychedelics, technology & human future, weird and strange, healing medicines.
title: Palenque Norte Speaker Series

description: The most fertile ground for the creation of life – our most precious and miraculous resource – is the context of a conscious relationship.  Those bonds of love form the fabric of our society and its ability to love, heal, and evolve – and your relationships are the crucible for your own transformation.   Learn how the total context of your relationship can be conscious love in this experiential dialog.
print_description: Relationships are the crucible for your own transformation. Join us for an experiential dialog/panel.
title: Panel On Conscious Relating:

description: Where are you in your own hero’s journey with respect to your sexuality?  Most psychological constructs acknowledge that sex and sexuality play a core role in the human tendencies towards achievement, success, fulfillment, control, and aggression.   How can conscious sexuality and the possible resulting sexual liberation lead to a broader liberation and re-fertilize the landscapes of creativity, collaborate effort, and peaceful conflict?  Join a diverse panel of experts and practitioners representing many interpretations of conscious sexuality.
print_description: Can conscious sexuality lead to a broader liberation and re-fertilize the landscapes of creativity, collaborate effort, and peaceful conflict?  Panel
title: Panel On Conscious Sexuality:

description: A recent study observed participants trapped in an elevator in groups of 10 or 11 people.  It turns out that the amount of time it takes a group of strangers to solve an unexpected problem is directly related to its diversity.  Completely homogenous groups failed to get out of their elevator at all, while the most diverse groups escaped in a few minutes.  This points to what we know intuitively to be true which is the cross fertilization of ideas, methodologies, and perspectives is essential to solving the biggest problems facing humanity today.
print_description: The cross fertilization of ideas, methodologies, and perspectives is essential to solving the biggest problems facing humanity today. Join a panel
title: Panel on Cross Fertilization:

description:
This workshop will warm you up with a playful and silly group yoga asana then take you through a few strengthening drills and partner stretches to get your body ready for play! 

You’ll then learn how the three roles of a partner flying work – the flyer, base and spotter – and learn how to support your partner in comfortable and therapeutic yoga poses up in the air!

We will finish with partner massage techniques that will connect you to your partner and keep the yumminess flowing.

No need to bring a partner, just yourself and some childish curiosity
print_description: This workshop will warm you up with a playful & silly group yoga asana then take you through a few strengthening drills &partner stretches.
title: Partner yoga, flying and partner massage

description: Party Naked is returning to the Playa for our fifth year to provide libations to thirsty Black Rock City citizens 21 and over. You must be 21 or over to Party here and we do ask for and check ID's (it's always good to carry your ID while at Burning Man). We start the mornings with Bloody Mary's at 9:00am until we run out. We then dispense our "Tiki Punch" (yes, it has a punch) well into the night. Party Naked Tiki Bar is the clothing optional bar that rewards your getting naked. This year we have 1800+ hand painted commemorative leis to give to citizens that "do it". Make sure to come by early and get lei'd. We will also have activities scheduled for fun at the bar, check out our schedule when you come by. We promote a no pressure relaxed atmosphere where you can get naked or not. Come by for a cool drink where you can sit and chat or meet new people. Enjoy our classic rock atmosphere music and a little shade in the heat of the day. Be LNT friendly and bring your own cup please.
print_description: Serving cold Tiki Punch to BRC citizens 21+ for 5 years. Have a seat, enjoy the rock, get naked here you may get lei'd.Please bring own cup and ID.
title: Party Naked and Get Lei'd

description: Come discover your most primal human attractions using nothing more than a sweaty t-shirt that you've worn for 24 hours on the playa!  In this experiment in human biological compatibility, participants seal their pheromone-soaked clothing in an anonymous plastic bag.  Subjects sniff their way through each bag and mark the degree to which they’re attracted or replused by each smell.  After a little decompression, matches will be announced to the surprise and delight of all involved.   Both LGBT and Straight friendly.  All are welcome, but make sure to show up on time with a sweaty T-shirt if you want to participate!
print_description: In an experiment in compatibility, follow your nose to matches using no more than a sweaty t-shirt you bring. LGBTQ & Heteros--all encouraged!!
title: Pheremonal Speed Dating

description: Core strength is the foundation of Pilates exercise. The core muscles are the deep, internal muscles of the abdomen and back. When the core muscles are strong and doing their job, as they are trained to do in Pilates, they work in tandem with the more superficial muscles of the trunk to support the spine and movement. Centering, Control, Flow, Breath, Precision, and Concentration: These six Pilates principles are essential ingredients in a high quality Pilates workout. Pilates mat exercises will develop strength, flexibility, coordination and balance.
print_description: Core strength is the foundation of Pilates exercise.This will help you develop strength, flexibility, coordination and balance.
title: Pilates

description:
In the strong Moonrock tradition of fuckery, revelry, and great bad
ideas, Plan B Laboratories aims to create alternative solutions to
common festival problems. Citizens can come avail themselves of our 
unorthodox answers to everyday disasters during daily staffed business hours. 
For instance, if your bike threw its chain, well, we can maybe hook you up 
with a martini. Or if you're down a shoe, we might have just the rollerskate 
you didn't know you needed. And if your problems are of a more abstract nature,
there'll be plenty of questionable advice on offer, too!

With the help of Plan B’s resources and regularly-scheduled workshops,
you won’t need a Plan C.

hosted_by_camp.name: Plan B Laboratories (a subsidiary of Moonrock Collective)

matched_name: Plan B Laboratories (a subsidiary of Moonrock Collective)
print_description: Plan B Laboratories: Solutions to common festival problems. Flat tire? No martini olives? With the help of Plan B’s resources you won't need a Plan C.
title: Plan B Laboratories

description:
Solve puzzles alone or together! Grab the first (easy) clue from Camp Cydonia, in the Alternative Energy Zone village, then take your time wandering the playa and searching for more.

Valuable prizes include: Love, the joy of discovery, the approval and praise of your fellow humans.

(Other prizes subject to availability, void where prohibited, do not lick, see your doctor if prizes last more than four hours.)

Come get your first clue from us whenever you're ready. Each clue, when solved, will lead you somewhere on the playa to find the next one. Once you get to the end, bring the last one back to us for valuable prizes as described above.

We promise fun times for all. (Actually we promise nothing, but we bet you'll enjoy it!) Come try it out!
print_description: Come solve puzzles with us! Grab the first (easy) clue from Cydonia in Alternative Energy Zone, then wander the playa searching for more. Try it out!

description:
Just what is Poly High Tea? - First, it's a Tea Party. We will be serving Tea and Cookies...

All you Polyamorous, poly-curious, and poly-friendly folks out there on the playa are invited to join us for a discussion about the practical issues of loving more than one in an open, responsible multi-person relationship. There are many workable forms of Polyamorous relationship - polyamory is polymorphic! There is much wisdom in the poly community which can be helpful to people trying to make *any* relationship work, monogamous or Polyamorous. There will be a facilitated discussion in which you can get your questions addressed and some of the knowledge in our community can be shared.

If you'd like to cool off and de-dust yourself after our tea party, bring a water donation to enjoy PolyParadise's famous Human Carcass Wash.
print_description: All you Polyamorous, poly-curious, and poly-friendly folks are invited to join us for a discussion about practical issues of loving more than one.
title: Poly High Tea

description: Presented by Rick Doblin.  We'll review the latest progress by non-profit organizations in developing psychedelic drugs into prescription medicines, especially the use of MDMA-assisted psychotherapy in veterans and others with chronic PTSD.  We’ll also discuss psychedelic harm reduction at festivals, with the world’s leading example being Boom Festival in Portugal, where drugs are decriminalized.

description: Galactic Mayan ritual playaformance by Pyronauts, the international all-star sacred theatre fire troupe and the Jedi Alliance. This will be a must see spectacle!!!There are 77 Pyronauts originating from 19 U.S. states and 23 countries worldwide and every Pyronaut is at the top of their art form. Some Pyronauts perform with Cirque du Soleil and others have won the HomeOfPoi.com "Circles of Light" international video competition. Pyronauts also feature one of the world's top Sword Swallowers and top Hula Hoopers who hold 2 world records each!Our ritual performances will take place in the Grand Plaza between the 66' & 55' tall Mayan Pyramid Temples of the Tikal 2012 Art Installation and Theme Camp.December 21st, 2012 is the simultaneous end and beginning of 5,125 and 25,625 year cycles of the Mayan Calendar which cosmically syncs up with the Galactic Alignment when our Winter Solstice Sun aligns with the equator of our Milky Way Galaxy. This unprecedented occurrence in human history may be a catalyst for an unparalleled shift in our collective consciousness! We intend to fully embody, honor, and celebrate this long anticipated and prophesized convergence of time and space... and we hope YOU will be a part of it with us!

description: Join us in our Lotus Dome for the daily recitation of Nam Myoho Renge Kyo and morning gongyo (the practice of chanting two chapters from the Lotus Sutra) In the Lotus Sutra Shakymuni Buddha revealed that every human being can attain enlightenment in their present form. Through chanting Nam Myoho Renge Kyo an individual is able to awaken this enlightenment the Buddha revealed and reveal their own Buddha nature. A practitioner of this Buddhism through chanting and study can transform their life and create a state of unshakable happiness overcoming the sufferings of birth and death. Buddhism is a practice and everyone is welcome to join. Each day after chanting together we will study a Buddhist concept, answer questions and share experiences about the practice and its application to our daily life. All are welcome to join us even if you have never chanted before.
print_description: Chanting of Nam Myoho Renge Kyo & Lotus Sutra. Join us to learn about practicing Buddhism and reveal your enlightened nature. All welcomed.
title: Recitation of Lotus Sutra: Nam Myoho Renge Kyo

description: Mark Heley will be presenting a totally new talk featuring new archaeological and epigraphic evidence of the significance of 2012 in the Maya cosmovision. Factual, informative and inspiring, this talk explores the transformative, visionary and psychedelic roots of the 2012 movement and presents a clear plan for reclaiming the 2012 meme as a celebration of planetary culture.
print_description: Mark Heley will be presenting a new talk featuring new archaeological and epigraphic evidence of the significance of 2012 in the Mayan cosmovision.
title: Reclaiming 2012: the transformative meme

description:
One of the most historically influential decades, the 1960s came and went, taking with them the ideologies of consciousness exploration, active environmentalism and true freedom until now.  After over 40 years of dormancy, a new revolution has emerged, taken shape, revealed its face and resonated a strong voice to guide the global community.

Mitch Schultz and Charles Shaw share their new feature length documentary that focuses the lens at the nexus of this next-generation mystical revival.  The growing worldwide community of like minds continues to grow and intentionally gather to celebrate life and create positive change on the planet.  The project takes the pulse of the culture at transformational festivals around the world in 2012, including Symbiosis, Lightning in a Bottle, Desert Rocks, Sonic Bloom, Boom, Burning Man, Australia’s Eclipse 2012 and Belize Solstice 2012, and many more.  With the backdrop of these amazing festivals and communicated through the individual festival participants, we explore a variety of different themes, including activism, art, consciousness, environmentalism, music, mythology, technology, and 2012 as a general framework to better understand and define the culture. 
Come join us, give us your opinion and help make a difference in the Universe.
print_description: Mitch Schultz and Charles Shaw share their new feature length documentary that focuses the lens at the nexus of the next-generation mystical revival.
title: Recoding the Transformation

description: Do you want to reduce the amount of recycling you will have to pack out? Great! Separate your aluminum cans and bring them to Black Rock City Recycle Camp!!! We are located in Center Camp at 6:00, directly behind the Cafe. The camp is "Open" and ready to accept your cans Monday through Sunday, 9am to 5pm. Bring your clean, separated aluminum cans only. We don't accept any other recyclables, you must pack them out. And we definitely don't want your trash. We provide a sorting area to check your cans for anything that isn't aluminum. Then you can ride the bike that powers the can crusher and crush your cans. After your cans get crushed, you will put your crushed cans into the large containers at the camp. All proceeds from the aluminum are donated to the Gerlach K-12 School in Gerlach, NV. Come join in the fun while doing a good thing for the planet and BRC..!
print_description: Do you want to reduce the amount of recycling you have to pack out? Great! Separate your aluminum cans & bring them to Black Rock City Recycle Camp!!!
title: Recycle your Aluminum Cans..!

description:
We practice yoga to create space in both our minds and our bodies. Through this workshop, we identify the areas where there is no space and together, we learn to let go of the restrictions that are preventing us from opening our hips, our heart and our mind.  

In this 2.5 hour workshop, students are facilitated to the discovery of their very own myofascial restrictions, and guided on how to release them. This is where the magic happens. This is the shift begins.

Ashley and Bryon work on an individual level to isolate the physical and emotional blockages that restrict us from achieving our full potential in each yoga posture. This revolutionizing approach to understanding the body will propel you years ahead in your yoga practice. Forget the eons of prep classes; you can meet your goals overnight. Revolutionized Yoga is the optimal solution for yoga practitioners that are craving a real, a rapid, a wild and a drastic shift in their yoga practice and their life.

Taught by Ashley Holly, MA, RYT and Bryon Brewster, CST, BCSI, MT, CHN, Osteopath, this workshop explores and shares the linkages between the connective tissue, fascia, movement and the asana.
print_description: Craving a real, a rapid, a wild and a drastic shift in your yoga practice? In your life? Learn to let go and propel you years ahead in your practice.
title: Revolutionized Yoga: Structurally Integrated Yoga

description:
Sacred Geometry and Earth Energies of the Portals is an in depth presentation of the interactive “Portal” installations by Harlan Emil that employ sacred geometry, color and sound for participants to experience an evolution of consciousness. The golden ratio and the 5 platonic solids that are utilized in their designs will be described, plus the next level of geometries they manifest. It will be explained how the Portal’s designs incorporate the geometric evolution of the Earth’s interactive energy body and relate to the human chakra system.

Harlan Emil Gruber is a large-scale sculptural artist who merges his interests in art, design, and science into a unique body of work. He received a degree in Environmental Design from Parsons School of Design in 1985. His diverse career has included art furniture, sound sculpture, future habitation concepts, and large-scale interactive installations. His work has been exhibited in a variety of settings, from galleries in New York City and New Mexico, to the Black Rock desert in Nevada for the Burning Man festival. These installations are now being brought to a variety of events around the world.
print_description: An in depth presentation of interactive Portal installations by Harlan Emil that employ sacred geometry, color & sound for participants to experience.
title: Sacred Geometry & Earth Energies of The Portals

description: The Sapphire Portal was inspired by concepts in The Emerald Modem: A Users Guide to the Earth’s Interactive Energy Body (2004). Author Richard Leviton describes etheric “blue dishes” under all sacred sites that collect subtle cosmic energies and distribute them into the earth and atmosphere. For Burning Man 2007 I designed a sky blue dish 61 feet in diameter and 9 1/2 feet high with sky blue carpet to physically manifest this idea while providing an environment of floating in the sky. In the center are three geometric forms that embody Leviton’s concept of an aspect of the Earth’s energy body evolving from its current geometric form to an icosidodecahedron. I built a half dodecahedron that houses the Quasar Wave Transducer sound sculpture that produces low frequency vibrations in the range of brain waves and earth resonance, and a half icosidodecahedron steel frame covered in stainless steel mirror triangles. These two shapes are shaded by a half icosahedron steel frame covered in aluminet shade cloth so that one may experience these shapes both day and night. A 30 foot section facing east was opened during sunrise. The Sapphire Portal acted as a personal, planetary and galactic vibrational alignemnent environment, providing profound experiences for many participants.
print_description: Come visist Harlan Emil Gruber's Sapphire interactive sound portal and be hypnotized by the sacred geometry, color and sound of it's toning hum.
title: Sapphire Sound Portal

description:
Fanning the Flame: A forum on the future of Burning Man culture

Is Burning Man still cool? How is the 27-year-old event's skyrocketing mainstream appeal changing burner culture? Can Black Rock City, that temporary desert city, really double in size to 100,000 citizens, as its founder envisions? Or is the future of this culture to be found off the playa, in cities around the world? And who will be calling the shots? 
Join Steven T. Jones – the Bay Guardian city editor and author of The Tribes of Burning Man: How an Experimental City in the Desert is Shaping the New American Counterculture – for a lively discussion of how this culture evolved and where it's headed. As one of the few journalists regularly working the Burning Man beat, he offers an inside yet independent perspective on this country's preeminent countercultural institution and its role in modern American life.
print_description: Forum with Scribe, aka Steven T. Jones, author of The Tribes of Burning Man: How an Experimental City in the Desert is Shaping the New
title: Scribe on the future of Burning Man

description:
Join us for an experiential dance journey held in the vibrancy of the 5 Rhythms, SheddingSkins and Dancing Freedom movement practices.

We will begin by discovering our sensual expression slowly from the inside...finding that center point of self-love and self-care and allowing it to grow from our heart center out into the physical, exploring from fingertips to belly to toes how to cultivate this feeling inside while inviting it to be present outside. 

From here we will reveal how to extend that dance to the space around us and (always in clear choice, never pushing beyond out own place of 'yes') then how to connect it with others, discovering how connecting affects our own dance, that of another and of the space between us...how to honor and care for self, invite sensual expression with others and allow each to be witnessed and held in that sweet dance of our authentic self which is ever connected, rooted and free. 

About Your Facilitators: 

Eugene Hedlund is a certified 5 Rhythms teacher and the founder of the SheddingSkins path of personal transformation. He is based in San Diego, California and teaches both 5 Rhythms and SheddingSkins workshops throughout the US and in Europe. 

The SheddingSkins path is a seamless blend of Movement Meditation, Sound Alchemy, Shamanic Ritual and Tantric Ceremony into one cohesive practice where each of these medicines are used to create a comprehensive system of personal transformation. 

www.sheddingskins.com 

Tessabella is a Massage Therapist and spiritual dance practitioner who has found great passion, grounding and healing in movement. Dance is both a therapy and a celebration for her. She loves the magic, power and immensity of the transformation and awakening she experiences in herself and others through movement.
print_description: Join us for an experiential dance born from the space between us and held in the vibrancy of the 5Rhythms, SheddingSkins and Dancing Freedom practices
title: Sensual Exploration and Empowerment through Dance

description:
Get your Sexploration on! Its time to get hot and sexy with other fabulous gender queer, trans, and queer folks.

This party is a safe space for trans, gender queer, gender variant, queer, open minded, unidentified folks to get their freak on. Sexy, hot, & off the hook. We practice safer sex and in order to play you must also. This party is designed with queer folks in mind. It is specifically a safe space for gender blenders, gender benders, trans, and gender questioning folks. It also is a safe space for cis-gendered queer folks. Feel free to bring toys, condoms, gloves, lube, and cute people - of course we will also be providing. Consent in our Gender Blender dome is a must. Keep it safe, sane, and consensual. We take our consent and safety seriously, if you are not interested in fun safe play, don't show up. If you can't play safely then you can't play in our dome. If you are ready for an amazing fabulous glittery kickin play party then this is the spot for you! All levels of play are welcome from first timers to sexperts. Respect in our dome is paramount. We are creating a unique space that is not found anywhere else on playa. This party is for people of all genders with a priority on creating safety for communities that are normally marginalized or exoticized. We can't wait to see your hotness shine at this phenomenal event.
All genders welcome all ways.

description:
A performance piece towards the experience of a collaborative action painting. A large canvas is set on the ﬂoor, as a stage. It is an invitation to dance with paint. To ground the experience into the canvas with sweat and laughing feet. Two performance pieces, one hour each. After the event, the canvas is laid out to dry, cut up in pieces and showcased at the camp. Each piece is marked with the title of the song, a quote, and a technical note. A follow-up party is intended to give out a piece of the painting to all of the participants.

David Black and Elizabeth Romo.
print_description: Come dance with others on a canvas and paint with your feet. Turn your movements into communal art that will be cut up and gifted after the dance!
title: “Songs of the Hearts on Fire”

description: The now infamous camp challenge is back. With origins dating all the way back to the 1980s, this camping tradition has morphed into something truly monstrous. During the heat of the day, in triple digit temperatures, one must eat a helping of five-alarm chili, cooked with the dreaded Guatemalan insanity pepper (grown only by the inmates of a Guatemalan insane asylum). Then, to wash it down, a shot of hot pepper vodka, also infused with the same insanely hot pepper. Now, when you want nothing more than an ice-cold beverage to quench the fire burning in your mouth, you instead must chug a cheap, warm beer that's been sitting out in the sun since daybreak. Why, might you ask, would anyone want to do this? Hell if we know! It's a terrible idea! It's a horrible thing to conceive, much less do on purpose! Yet, as demonstrated by the droves of people who participated AND completed the challenge in 2009 and 2010, we apparently underestimated human nature. Not only did crowds show up for the challenge, but they returned over the course of the week to to share the pain with their friends. And by share, we mean point and laugh while grown men cried and stumbled down the street in a daze. We even had a university anthropologist come hangout, just to observe this odd aspect of human behavior.  We're bringing it back spicier than ever for 2012!
print_description: The Challenge - Can you handle the heat? Super spicy vodka, spicy evil chili, and ...warm beer???  Are you hot enough?
title: So You Think You're Hot?

description: This workshop is for those considering consensual non-monogamy, those practicing it, and those just curious. We will define consensual non-monogamy and differentiate it from other relationship styles. We will share our experiences in the consensual non-monogamy world. Styles of consensual non-monogamy discussed include open relations, swinging, polyamory, polifidelity, and single but non-monogamous. We will discuss how we deal with jealousy, as well as some risks. Most of all we will try to answer whatever questions you may have.
print_description: Workshop on non-monogamy such as open relations, swinging, polyamory, polifidelity, & single/non-monogamous. How to deal with jealousy & other risks
title: So, you want to be a SLUT?

description: In "Religion for Atheists" Alain de Botton argues that "rather than mocking religions, agnostics and atheists should instead steal from them – because they're packed with good ideas on how we might live and arrange our societies." This discussion is about distilling the tools of religions from the dogmas that surround them. (Don't don't throw out the baby with the holy water!) Rather than trying to cover this whole topic in a single workshop, the goal will be to introduce the general concepts while facilitating the sharing of resources (books, articles, quotes, etc.) for people to explore on their own. Please bring something to share.
print_description: This discussion is about distilling the tools of religions from the dogmas that surround them. Please bring something to share.
title: Spirituality for Atheists

description: Dust and Desert surround us and inspire us in magical and surprising ways at Burning Man. These also happen to be rich, recurring images in Jewish tradition. We were originally created out of dust and we all eventually return to dust, and dust in the wind is a profound reflection of the human condition. Desert is the site of revelation and the unknown, and it is the liminality where we wander between narrowness and wholeness. We'll look at some texts from the Torah, from the ancient Sages, and from modern Jewish thought. And, together, we'll also look inward and outward in new ways.
print_description: Come and learn how the motifs of “dust” and “desert” in Jewish tradition shed light on what it means to be human and what it means to seek the divine.
title: Spiritual Meaning of "Dust" & "Desert" in Judaism

description: Straight Shaving and Pipe Smoking.   Once upon a time, men smoked pipes and shaved with straight razors.  Camp DIY wants to make pipe smoking cool again and take back our power from the 5 blade razor! Attend a workshop hosted by Kevin, a recent convert to pipe smoking and straight razor shaving, where he shows you what he's learned about both.  Unlike the olden times, pipe smoking and straight razor shaving will be open to women, but Kevin claims no knowledge of what a women can do with her straight razor and accepts no liability.  We welcome old time pipe smokers and/or straight razor users to join us for the camaraderie (pipe smoking allowed but no smirking at us newbies). Bring your pipes and/or the  paraphernalia you use to sharpen your blade. Show and Tell from workshop participants on techniques follows presentation.

description: Do you remember the first time you were surprised by your closest friends with a party ? Sure, it may have been a little scary at first but that’s all part of the thrill before you realize how everyone is there to celebrate you! Two campmates will venture out and use any silly excuse to get lucky random people to come into camp while the rest hide and remain quiet. Upon entering, we will all jump out and yell “Surprise!” while the DJ turns up the volume, signalling the start of some of the most outrageous dancing on the playa. After a short time, we repeat the procedure, inviting more and more Burners into the ultimate ‘80s-themed dance party.
print_description: The ultimate surprise party!  Attendees hide & get quiet, then random burners are lured into the party. We yell SURPRISE & the 80s dancing continues.

description:
"The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body." ~ Gabrielle Roth

The 5Rhythms is an in-bodied, out of your mind  dance experience not to be missed. It is a simple, powerful moving meditation that anyone – of any age, size, or physical ability - can practice. There are no steps to follow, no choreography to learn, no way to do it wrong. The only requirement is a body that is still breathing, a heart that is still beating, and mind that is still curious! 

Just like light, sound or ocean waves, a dancing body when moving freely passes through five distinct rhythmic patterns. These patterns continuously repeat themselves in a wave of motion.

The 5Rhythms are:

FLOWING – the fluid, continuous, grounded glide of our own movements

STACCATO – the percussive, pulsing beat that shapes us a thousand different ways

CHAOS – the rhythm of letting go, releasing into the catalytic wildness of our dance that can never be planned or repeated

LYRICAL – the rhythm of trance, where the weight of self-consciousness dissolves, where we lighten up and disappear into our own uniqueness

STILLNESS – the quiet emptiness, where gentle movements rise and fall, start and end, in a field of silence

Please join RhythmWave as we return to the Black Rock City for our sixth year with this gorgeous dance/meditation practice that we love to share with you!
print_description: 5Rhythms on a shaded bamboo floor-an in-bodied, out-of-your mind conscious dance experience not to be missed. No experience needed, just an open heart
title: Sweat Your Prayers at RhythmWave

description:
From Chaos to Cosmic Coincidence.

Grab a cuppa, say hi to Ouroboros and jump aboard the fractal express, a galactic voyage through the archetypes to infinity and back; from mythology to chaos theory. Follow the white rabbit on a journey through the mandalic world of cosmic coincidence, open the door to lady serendipity and invite her in for a pot of freshly brewed synchronici-tea.

Take a stroll into the infinite corridor of chaos and discover the self recursive nature of reality from humans to dark matter. This workshop will unravel the fractal geometry of our universe and allow you to witness the organic structures that grow straight out of the abyss - in the words of Douglas Hofstadter:

“It turns out that an eerie type of chaos can lurk just behind a facade of order - and yet, deep inside the chaos lurks an even eerier type of order.”

Just a coincidence? Our lives tend to orchestrate a storyline filled with bizarre synchronicities and connections seemingly beyond explanation, however most are unaware of the extent that our cosmos reflects this characteristic. Ever wondered why the moon and the sun appear to be the same size from Earth? From the atom to the solar system, in this workshop we take a look into the truly unbelievable level of serendipity inherent in our universe.
print_description: Fractal journeys from chaos to cosmic coincidence; an open invitation for lady serendipity to come in for a pot of freshly brewed synchronici-tea.
title: SynchroniciTea Workshop

description:
Learn how to partner dance with Tangoed up in Blues (Monday-Thursday).  We teach tango and blues classes, follow them up with practice time, then happy hour (often with live music), and dances in the evenings.  Tango milongas are Monday and Wednesday, Blues dances on Tuesday and Thursday.

In our classes, you'll learn how to do these two social partner dances, how to connect with the music and your partner, how to relax, you'll get to meet and interact with your playa brethren, and you'll dance a bunch.

During the guided practice time, you'll have a chance to practice during the day and ask questions of the experienced dancers hanging out.

At happy hour, grab a drink, dance and chill. Listen to live music if we have a drop-in musician (or let us know if you you'd like to play some blues or tango music at our camp).

And then in the evening, dress up, and come dance the night away.  We keep the music running at all hours.
print_description: Learn how to partner dance with Tangoed up in Blues.  We teach tango and blues classes and host dances in the evenings.
title: Tango Class

description:
A hatha yoga practice for the subtle body.  From sacred movement, through breath, into stillness we find the vastness inside ourselves where we remember our connection to all that is.  

Tuesday: Tantric Yoga and Meditation for Ajna and Sahashara Chakra:   Practice will focus on the sixth and seventh chakra and our connection to space and divinity.
Wednesday: Tantric Yoga and Meditation for Muladhara and Svadhisthana Chakras:  Practice will focus on the first and second chakras and our connection to earth and water.
Thursday: Tantric Yoga and Meditation for Manipura Chakra:  Practice will focus on the third chakra and our connection to the fire element.
Friday: Tantric Yoga and Meditation for Anahata and Vishuddhi Chakras:  Practice will focus on the fourth and fifth chakra and our connection to the breath and energy.
print_description: Yoga for the subtle body.  From sacred movement, through breath, to stillness find the vastness inside and remember your connection to all that is.
title: Tantric Yoga & Meditation

description:
Nothing new can emerge without first a coming together. Creation -- in all of its infinite forms -- requires an encounter: of people, of materials, of ideas. Everything was born of relations -- of chemistry and community, of labor and love. Every single thing.

This simple truth poses important questions: For if everything is born from a cauldron of relations -- from whence comes the spark? And might not some types of relations prove more an obstacle to creativity than its fertile soup? Answers to these questions could in turn help us to answer perhaps the most important question of all: How can we create a more creative world?

On Thursday August 30, 2012, TEDxBlackRockCity seeks to investigate the nature of creativity and possibilities of its fluorescence.
print_description:
How can we create a more creative world?

On Thursday August 30, 2012, TEDxBlackRockCity seeks to investigate the nature of creativity.
title: TEDxBlackRockCity - Pro:Creation

Tuckered out from all your hard work? You can view all the action from the upper-level hammock netting inside the dome. So come by and enjoy it, you deserve it! Not too tuckered to try out those new dancin' shoes? Break them in to the best DJs Boston's got to offer!

10-11: Serial Krusher
11-12: Moldover
12-1: Friar Tuck
1-2: Encanti

description:
The long standing Tradition continues again in 2012. Wednesday afternoon at 6:00pm, Spanky's Wine Bar and the famous Burning Band will host LBD.  Males and females alike will don their wildest, most elaborate, sexiest and/or skimpiest little black dresses and follow and sing with the greatest marching band on the playa, through the streets of Burningman to Center Camp and back.Those with marching band instruments (yes, kazoos count) are welcomed to "join the band"
Huzzah!!!!!
This is a long standing playa tradition, so be sure to include an LBD in your Burningman packing list this year.

A private event space for explorations of primate-inspired community where grooming plays a vital role in the formation of social bonds. + adults only, no one under 18 is allowed
+ no penetration, not even open-mouth kissing
+ ask first, yes means yes, no means no
