description:
By night, indulge yourself in transcendent experience as you enter 
another world within The Crystal Cavern. Surrounded by two story 
fluorescent crystals, vividly colored mushrooms, and silk mandalas, enjoy live and recorded music - mandolin, shamanic icaros, world beat, down tempo, and at least one night of psytrance. Come lounge on the soft, fluffy pillows and absorb our ambiance, light shows, and music.

By day, our comfortable 40-foot dome hosts the Palenque Norte Speaker Series (see separate listing). Enjoy presentations from leaders in the visionary, entheogenic, and psychedelic communities.

In the morning, bring your yoga mat and join us for morning and evening community yoga practice in our yoga area. Leave the dust behind and expand your body and mind.
print_description: Visually striking 40’ dome lounge with giant fluorescent crystals, mushrooms, fluffy pillows. Live & recorded music–down tempo, world beat, psytrance.
title: The Crystal Cavern

description:
Poets! Storytellers! Troubadours! Ever wanted to spout your verse from atop a giant phallus? well, here's your golden opportunity! 

Come along to Baal-Mart's Great Phallic Poetry Slam! We will be in need of both competitors to fight to the wordy death and raucus and enthusiastic audience members to cheer them along. Judges will be randomly selected out of the audience. 

Be there early to sign up as space will be limited in the slam. 

There will be two rounds. 

3 minute time limit.
No music unless you're a wicked beatboxer. 
Costumes ok (this is Burning Man!).
Original material encouraged.

In case of a tie, we go to sudden death Haiku Battle! 

See you and your awe inspiring rhymes on Tuesday 2pm, for your chance to be crowned the Baal-Mart Great Phallic Slam Champion!
print_description: Poets! Storytellers! Troubadours! Ever wanted to spout your verse from atop a giant phallus? Now you can! 2 rounds. Come early to sign up for the slam
title: The Great Phallic Poetry Slam

description:
The Great Work  - Knowledge and Conversation with the Holy Guardian Angel

Aleister Crowley believed Knowledge and Conversation with one’s Holy Guardian Angel should be the preeminent goal of every magician. This experience has been described as the Great Work wherein the microcosm and macrocosm merge together producing transformative change in the life of the initiate. The yearning for thisSummum Bonum has been described by St. Augustine of old who wrote of god that “our heart is restless until it finds its rest in thee.” Join us as we explore the centrality of Knowledge and Conversation from the perspective of Thelema and how this most sacred of doctrines can impact your life.
print_description: Aleister Crowley believed Knowledge and Conversation with one’s Holy Guardian Angel should be the preeminent goal of every magician. Learn More!
title: The Great Work  - Holy Guardian Angel

description: For several years, our camp has presented the Motel which offered BM guests a chance to have fun as well as to entertain their fellow Burners with safe adult entertainment.  We have provided a motel motif that includes clean bedding, an ice bucket, and other classic motel environs to promote what adults do in such situations.  At the same time, their shadows are projected on the fabric walls to entertain the outside guests with their ‘shadow play.’  This is the perfect melding of the voyeurs and exhibitionists that populate BRC.  For many of our previous guests, our motel has provided them an opportunity to do something they may have only dream of prior, but in a playful and anonymous manner.  This is our contribution to what we consider one of the most important aspects to a great BM experience; it is not a spectator sport!
print_description: Entertain fellow Burners with your shadow play which is projected on the fabric walls to entertain the outside guests.Voyeurism meet exhibitionists
title: The G-Spot Party: The Motel (3  & E)

description:
The essence of the Heart of Now is the practice of being present with your whole self. In The Heart of Now workshop, you’ll come to know yourself more deeply. You’ll discover the possibility of reconnection with your innate beauty, wholeness and be honest with yourself and and with others in a safe circle of love. You can discover those places you’ve felt stuck, while you are supported in letting go. You learn to become aware of those times when you get in your own way, and come to see the choices open to you. You embrace what you desire the most, and deeply commit to letting your dreams and your visions be more important than you past wounds. You will find yourself reconnecting with your innate beauty, wholeness and power in each moment.

Heart of Now workshops include numerous assistants to support you and to create a sacred space for transformation. A deeply nurturing environment is created. This teamwork approach deepens the experience of service and camaraderie, where all are able to experience their vulnerabilities, allowing trust and growth. For questions visit our website www.HeartOfNow.org.
print_description: The essence of the Heart of Now is the practice of being present with your whole self. You’ll come to know yourself more deeply.
title: The Heart of Now

description:
Objectives
In this 90-minute workshop, you’ll learn:
- The real reason you (or someone else) feels angry
- Why anger, properly interpreted, increases mutual respect and social harmony
- A simple technique you can use to resolve anger.

Format
During this highly interactive workshop, you’ll have an opportunity to:
- Examine your existing beliefs about what causes you to become angry
- Learn what new research reveals about the true cause of anger
- Apply this new understanding of anger to a real-life situation in which you are experiencing anger
- Create a learning plan for assimilating this new understanding of anger into your life.

The class includes Short Lecture, Self Reflection, Expert Instruction, Partner Exercises and Large Group Debrief.

Materials
Following the workshop, you’ll receive PDF copies of:
- The Adaptive Inquiry Guide to Honoring Anger
- The Adaptive Inquiry Worksheet for Honoring Anger
- The Adaptive Inquiry Quick Reference Card for Honoring Anger.
print_description:
LEARN why anger, properly interpreted, increases mutual respect. 
PRACTICE a simple technique for resolving your anger.
title: The Lustrous Gem of Anger

description:
Once, I planned an event where a bunch would get together and watch episodes of "The Mighty Boosh." That was July the 2nd, Nine'een-seventy-nine, the day The Funk died. Two weeks later, I found The Funk in bed with Dr. LeTawdry and a conger eel. At first, I thought it was a sea anemone, but under closer inspection, I realized it was a funky balls o' tits from outer space! I'm Old Gregg.

Thanks to George Clinton and a Himalayan sherpa with a choice DVD collection and a bad case of dermatitis, The Mighty Boosh comes to the Playa, where Old Gregg and The Hitcher tend to frequent. Who knows what will happen, but it's guaranteed to be epic! I'm Old Greggggggggg!!
print_description: Come drink Baileys from a shoe. Bring your own damn shoe! Watch choice Boosh episodes! Come dressed as your favorite, or least favorite, character!
title: The Mighty Boosh Is On The Loose!

Camp on Thursday between 3 and 4, and we'll get you properly attired. Afterward, join your fellow Waldos at Where's Waldo? Camp for a Waldo meet-and-greet.

description: Cool off in the Misting Dome, your oasis in the Black Rock Desert! Soothe yourself under the 10 powerful misting jets filled with pure Sierra snowmelt, obtained from a 9000 ft mountain spring. After your mist, head over to our adjacent Oasis Lounge and relax in the shade with a glass of wine or water.  When the sun sets, misting ends and the black lights come on, illuminating the beautiful "River of Time" mural. The Poi pond comes alive with hula hoopers, poi spinners and light background music.  This will be the Misting Dome's last year on the playa. Stop by and celebrate a great 2012 with us!
print_description: Celebrate the Misting Dome's last year on the playa! We're bringing 800 gallons of pure Sierra snowmelt for misting; don't make us take any home!

description: The Orgasamator is back, at the Camp for Sensual Pleasures. The Orgasmatron had been a fixture at Burning Man for many years, giving thousands of women extreme physical pleasure in an environment that was very safe, comfortable and private. Two years ago we took everything we had learned and completely redesigned the machine for even greater intensity and enjoyment, and we gave it a new name: The Orgasamator. You may have seen it at Spanky’s Wine Bar. This year we’ve taken it that much further with a singular goal of maximizing our guests’ overall pleasure, along with the comfort and sensuality of the environment. When you visit, you will be in a private room with an operator who is experienced, very sensitive to your needs and concerns, and deeply dedicated to giving you an amazing experience in an environment that is safe, comfortable and private, and which leaves you feeling completely respected and in control. Come solo, or better yet, bring a good friend (male or female) to add another dimension to this deeply immersive and personal experience. You can wear as much or as little as you would like while riding this marvelous machine, and you can stop any time if the pleasure becomes too intense. If you are a woman, the Orgasamator Experience at our I-Scream Parlour is something you won't want to miss. Visit us at the Camp for Sensual Pleasures, in Spanky’s Village, and also ask about The Pope’s Massage & Hair washing.

hosted_by_camp.name: Sensual Pleasures, The Camp for Sensual Pleasures

matched_name: Sensual Pleasures, The Camp for Sensual Pleasures
print_description: We've upgraded our well-known Orgasmatron this year to give women even more intense physical pleasure, in an environment that's safe and comfortable.
title: The Orgasamator Experience

description: Remember "The Dating Game", that truly awful television show from the 1960s where a couple of losers and one decent fellow would try and win the hand of some deserving bachelorette?  Yeah, stupid I know.  Well, your friends from Barbie Death Village and our subcontinental themecamp BollyVille will be hosting India's own version: The Punjabi Dating Game!  We need three eligable bachelors (or even more because there's enough of Ninzy to handle Gunga Din's personal hoardes) and come Friday evening before The Wall Street Burn out on the deep playa we will be hosting our show.  Complete with playa-sanctioned pyrotechnics, our 45 minute show will be an eye-popping experience indeed.  Head out beyond the Temple and look for the 21st Century version of The Dating Game set, pull up a chair, and get your curry on.  The winning bachelor and Ninzy will be whisked away in our very own Barbie's Mobile Whorehouse in plush comfort, complete with champagne and minions to act like sycophants to their very beck and call, and escorted to The Wall Street Burn.  Afterwards the lovely couple will come back to Barbie Death Camp to perhaps consumate their date.  Or not.  You never know for sure but one thing is certain:  A splendid time is guaranteed for all.

description: There is an unlimited or nearly unlimited supply of everything we could need or want (water, food, love, value, sex, happiness).  The single biggest obstacle between us and living in a world where this is apparent to everyone is the meme of scarcity and our belief in its existence.  For those of us on the edge of truly surrendering to an abundance mindset, truly walking through the world as fully resourced people, how do we take the last few steps for ourselves and each other?  This panel discusses pragmatic methods of transferring from scarcity to abundance in any context for ourselves and those around us.
print_description: Surrender to an abundance mindset - Pragmatic methods of transferring from scarcity to abundance in any context for ourselves and those around us.
title: There Is Enough Of Everything For Everyone – A Pan

description:
A smorgasbord of performance art, music, and spoken word. Bring your  5 -10 min performance to share. Or participate in the Battle of Words hip hop and spoken word slam down. Come early if you have special tech requests. On Playa collaborations and works in progress encouraged. Bear Margaritas for all!!

The Salon is a night of creative expression. Our community started hosting salons in January 2010 as a safe space for the folks of Synchronicity and our friends to share finished or unfinished works of art, poetry, song, or any form of creative release.  The idea was to encourage people in the community to create, share, and hear thoughts or ideas from fellow creative souls.  It has since expanded, and we have enjoyed works of musicians, poets, storytellers, palindromists, historians, novelists, ramblers, gamblers, painters, filmmakers, drunks, fathers, mothers, lovers, dreamers, and psychedelic clowns from all over this land!
A crowd of lovely folks from across the playa will be gathering at 7.30 pm in preparation for the night's event.  A list will be roaming around, with 20 spots to fill. As 8 pm nears, we pile in front of our stage and are greeted by the lovely host of the evening.  From there.. anything goes!
print_description: Come to Camp Sync for a wonderful evening of community and creativity. Artists are invited to share their hearts/talents. Join the artistic reverie!
title: The Salon at Summer Camp Sync. @ Sundown

description:
The Saraswati Tea House offers fine teas and herbal infusions served in the Chinese Gong Fu tea tradition. The Tea House is a refuge where guests can rest, rehydrate and have quiet conversations. The tea ceremony provides stillness in the midst of chaos. All are welcome at the tea tables where servers offer compassionate hospitality and moist towelettes to refresh journeying visitors.

The Saraswati Tea House has both indoor and outdoor lounge spaces serving tea and providing an oasis for visitors who need a place to reflect on the ebb and flow of their personal cosmic journey. Tended day and night by our gentle tea servers, we honor Saraswati, the Hindu Goddess of Cosmic Knowledge, by welcoming those who need respite, insight, and a kind word during their passage towards wisdom and evolved consciousness. You are welcome to rest and reflect at the Saraswati Tea House during your transformation and initiation.
print_description: A tranquil lounge providing fine teas and herbal infusions in the Chinese Gong Fu tradition for those needing rest, rehydration, and conversation.
title: The Saraswati Tea House

description: Presented by Annie Oak.  The Saraswati Tea House was launched at Burning Man 2011 as a place for guests to rest, rehydrate and participate in the Chinese Gong Fu tea ritual. It's creators continued this project off the playa where it evolved into the Full Circle Tea House and continues to serve at many festivals and gatherings - including the 2012 Burn. This talk will describe how this model of community tea service can be used to provide compassionate hospitality at events where there are often too few friendly spaces that offer water, warm tea, quiet conversation, grounding ritual and a place to nap.
print_description: Presented by Annie Oak. This talk will describe how community tea service can provide grounding ritual and "compassionate hospitality" at events.
title: The Tea House as Community Artform

description: Presented by Jamie Janover.  Learn about Nassim Haramein’s lifelong journey into the geometry of space-time, which has lead to a coherent understanding of the fundamental structure and dynamics of the universe and our existence in it. In this presentation, Jamie Janover will take you on a journey through humanity’s evolution, exposing the changes necessary to produce a Unified Physics; a unification of not only the forces of nature but also the occurrence of consciousness, one which also reveals emerging parallels between ancient codes left in documents and monuments with the most modern day advanced scientific ideas. This all-encompassing theory may prove to be one of the most important discoveries of our time.
print_description: Jamie Janover will take you on a journey through humanity’s evolution, exposing the changes necessary to produce a Unified Physics.
title: The Unified Field Theory and Beyond

description:
Come experience the liberating intimacy of presence exercises combined
with transparent communication creating a safe space of intensity that
will allow participants to become aware and explore shadow elements in
the personality. These shadows are unconscious elements that are
preventing greater intimacy in relationships and affecting all aspects
of life. Shadows can create an inability to be fully Authentic with
people. Two major symptoms of shadow elements are both Anxiety and
Depression. Shadow Work addresses the real underlying causes instead
of the symptoms that manifest. Most often it is an uncomfortableness
with vulnerability occurring during development that created an
unconscious shielding and protecting of the Heart. This workshop will
give the awareness practices to become aware of Shadow Elements and
inspiration to integrate them. The benefits of this work if done with
a Willingness to Open is a richer fuller life.
print_description:
Come experience the liberating intimacy of presence exercises combined
with transparent communication creating a safe space of intensity
title: The Willingness to Open

description:
In our 60ft dome, THRIVE creator Foster Gamble will screen his revolutionary film and host an inspired dialogue after the screening.

THRIVE is an unconventional documentary that lifts the veil on what's REALLY going on in our world by following the money upstream -- uncovering the global consolidation of power in nearly every aspect of our lives. Weaving together breakthroughs in science, consciousness and activism, THRIVE offers real solutions, empowering us with unprecedented and bold strategies for reclaiming our lives and our future.

INTERVIEWS in THRIVE
Duane Elgin, Nassim Haramein, Steven Greer, Jack Kasher, Daniel Sheehan, Adam Trombly, Brian O'Leary, Vandana Shiva, John Gatto, Deepak Chopra, David Icke, Catherine Austin Fitts, G. Edward Griffin, Bill Still, John Perkins, Aqeela Sherrills, Evon Peter, Angel Kyodo Williams, Elisabet Sahtouris, Amy Goodman, and Barbara Marx Hubbard.
print_description: In our 60ft. dome, THRIVE creator Foster Gamble will screen his revolutionary film on the big screen and host an inspired dialogue afterwards.
title: THRIVE Screening/Dialogue with Foster Gamble

description:
We learn tickling as a form of play and a form of connection. With us you will take it to the next level as a form of sensation play or even a bit of dominance and submission with your partner. Where you take it is up to you. The class is taught by men and women who have been involved in the tickling community for several years.

It is best to bring a partner to play with and something comfortable to lay upon. We will provide some basic tickling instruments and a bit of rope if you want to bind your partners wrists during the exercise (optional). If you don't have a partner you may still attend and listen or we might match you up. Due to possible space limitations we may give preference to those with a partner first.

Volunteers are also welcome for our demos. This is an audience participation so be prepared to laugh, giggle, snort, chortle, etc.

Although tickling is not always in an adult setting due to the nature of the talk and our interaction we ask that all participants and observers be at least 18 years of age. All genders and orientations are welcome to attend and volunteer.

You will learn some new techniques to enhance sensual play with other people and we will teach you some ticklish locations you may not have been aware of.

If the class is interested we can go into more of a deeper talk about the power exchange aspect of tickling.

Come visit us and have fun. We'll likely either be in the large dome or under shelter at Otis Spankmore. We will post sign(s) to help direct you to the class.
print_description: Learn the sensation play of tickling. Bring a partner and something to lay on. No partner? We’ll match you if we can. 18+ only. All genders welcome.
title: Tickling 101

description:
In this creative 5Rhythms exploration we will move from surface to essence, from our individual stories towards the artistry of being an empowered creative force in harmony with the whole.  We will physically explore the concepts of community and  holding space for ourselves and others. Together, we will cultivate an inner and outer listening which will invite us into a place beyond words where instinct and intuition reign. 

The 5Rhythms “tribal work” is a practice where we cultivate the ability to be good leaders and a powerful part of a the collective.  In this 2 hour workshop we will artistically expand our capacity towards the kind of freedom that allows our own personal expressions to live and thrive in harmonious vibration with the whole.  We will dance, sweat and pray for the possibility to arrive into the breath-full, blissful meditative beat of the One.
print_description: The 5Rhythms “tribal work” is a dance practice where we cultivate the ability to be good leaders and a powerful part of a the collective.
title: Tribe - A 5Rhythms Workshop w/Amber Ryan

description: TribeTalks is a dynamic venue that enables participants to offer wisdom offerings to the community within a casual, cafe-like environment. Each talk is offered within 3-10 minutes, providing a efficient way to share and enable co-creation and connections. No powerpoint presentations or projections. A dedicated team of partners host, organize, gather information, film, catalog, and share the presentations to our online networks for further co-creation opportunit. The vision is to build a living, open, online forum and resource for participants to have their voices heard and visions seen by our global human family!http://www.youtube.com/TribeTalksOffered and coordinated by Bridgewalkers and The Convergence Networkhttp://www.bridgewalkers.comhttp://theconvergencenetwork.org/
print_description: TribeTalks is an open forum for participants to offer 3-10 min talks to the community on a wide range of subjects.  Come and be inspired!

Not only will we have Miracle Fruit, blocking your tongue's sour/bitter receptors so that sour tastes sweet and lemons taste like candy -- but for the first time, we will also be bringing Gymnema, a plant which does precisely the reverse, muting the sweet flavor of foods. So come, sample our wares (before they run out!) and explore your Sweet and Tart sides.
print_description: Give your mind a rest and let your tongue trip out. Explore Miracle Fruit- turning sour into sweet, and Gymnema- muting sweet flavors of foods.
title: Ultimate Flavor Tripping: Sweet or Tart?

description:
Vision Quest Roulette is 3 wheels: Spin two for your destination (Let's say you get 5:30 and C street) then spin the big one for a Vision Quest (like... Start a game of Tag with strangers!) Now your job is to go there and DO IT! ---------------------------
Some quests are more challenging, like "Give away something very precious to you, accept nothing in return" and some leave your fate to chance... "Find the quiet man in the hat, tell him you are on a Vision Quest, ask him what to do next." ----------> Every quest has you interact with your fellow BRC citizens and step a little out of your comfort zone. -----------------> Spinning the wheels is a great way to see new things, meet new people, and maybe stumble onto a playa lesson or two. -----> Warning: Only spin the wheels if you plan on doing a quest before the end of the Burn... Our resident hippies have put weird hippy magic into the wheels... quests ignored may have unknown consequences... ------------------------ Right across from Center Camp at Blackrock Yearbook (Inner Circle and 4:44) Get your photo taken by the Yearbook while you are there!
print_description: Vision Quest Roulette: Spin for your destination, then spin for a Vision Quest. Right across from Center Camp in front of the Blackrock Yearbook
title: Vision Quest Roulette

description:
Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul in connection with your breath and movement during this yoga class. Be inspired and take your body to a higher self-awareness by joining me in a traditional Kundalini Yoga warm-up and introductory set/kriya. If you are already experienced in yoga, you can incorporate longer time and more intense movement into the exercises, and benefit from realizing and stretching the boundaries of your physical abilities. 
Come to this class at least 90 minutes after eating a meal, in comfortable clothing that will allow for a full range of movement. Bring a healthy snack with you to enjoy after the class. Bring a water bottle you can fill it at the Pink Heart water bar, or your own favorite hydration to enjoy during the class. Yoga mat not necessary, but recommended.
print_description: Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul in connection with your breath and movement during this yoga class.
title: Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul

description: Want to know more about Gabrielle Roth’s 5Rhythms movement practice? Join RhythmWave's Spinnaker (aka Cynthia Kennedy from Olympia Washington) to this 2 hour class and be gently guided through each of the rhythms: flowing, staccato, chaos, lyrical and stillness. Each rhythm focuses on a simple movement quality rather than a specific form or set of steps, giving everyone the freedom to move in ways that feel authentic without any pressure to get it right. With a little instruction, the experience of the 5Rhythms opens us deeply and helps us move beyond self-consciousness to an authentic connection to our body and life force. Using the discipline of each rhythm and the breath as a catalyst for movement, you will be invited to embody, follow, express, and release your own energy. In the end, you will find yourself renewed and reconnected to your own self, feeling fully alive.
print_description: Want to know more about Gabrielle Roth’s 5Rhythms movement practice? Come to this gently guided class through each of the rhythms of ecstatic dance
title: What are those 5Rhythms Anyway? w/Spinnaker

description:
Do you desire to indulge your old world saloon whore fantasy? 

Come to the Black Rock French Quarter Friday evening to get your fill. Dress yourself in corsets bloomers striped stocking bustles parasols lace lace lace and any other variety of old world whore regalia. Bring your well dressed John as long as he brings his best bottle of whiskey and or scotch. 
Drape yourself from the balconies of the Quarter and cat call and caterwaul the early evening away. 

The whoring will take place from 5-8 followed by a burlesque show and the an electro swing dance party. 

BYOWhiskey and Scotch. And whatever else you would like to bring. 

What says fertility more than whore house?

Meow!

description:
My name is Tex Allen and I wear a clown nose 90% of the time I'm outside of my home. Whythenose.com is dedicated to the act of wearing a clown nose everyday, in order to make people smile.

It’s here for YOU…to encourage you with an act of Heroic Uninhibited Innocence.
It’s really that simple. In a world filled with distractions and distrust, you’d be amazed at how many people have lost a sense of childlike wonder. Or maybe you wouldn’t…

In the year since WhyTheNose was launched on the Playa at Rites of Passage, the project has transformed not only me, but it's brought together thousands of people through the photos and videos I've created.

Wearing a clown nose is fun, it’s easy, and it’s free if you already have the nose. YOU CAN COME GRAB ONE AT CENTER CAMP CAFE AND OTHER LOCATIONS ALL WEEK AT BRC...I'm bringing 5000 :)

WhyTheNose is only here to show you how joyful it is to change someone’s day with a simple, silly act.
Trust me, the nose breaks through barriers and opens doors every time you wear it…give it a try!

When you wear it and you’re waiting with a kind word, a laugh, a validation that you’re NOT crazy, just happy?
MAN, that’s powerful powerful stuff!

Ultimately, one’s attitude, your inner light, your reason raison d’etre that can make a difference in people’s lives and it’s a simple as the nose on your face.

Be loving and see what happens!

The inclusion of the nose is what creates the dissonance and that slight shift in “reality” is very important..it can (gently) jar people enough to open that door, that opportunity in them for opening up and taking a chance, taking a little risk to interact with someone they don’t know..who has on a clown nose!?!

Find WhyTheNose at Center Camp Cafe all week and if you pick up a Nose, would you please wear it Wednesday? I want YOU to help me spread the joy and beauty and ethos of OUR community with this one act you take take home and use every day :)

Thank's for the love, sfTex
print_description: WhyTheNose Wednesday is a day dedicated to wearing a clown nose, just because it's fun! Free Noses will be available all week at Center Camp Cafe!
title: WhyTheNose Wednesday

description: All of human life on earth can be divided between ignorance of metal (the Stone Age) and the mastery of it: the Bronze Age, when arrows got tips, cookware was no longer mere pottery, and the door opened to the alchemy of advanced human invention because we were no longer limited to constructing in wood and earthenware.  You cannot NOT watch metal liquify.  It is entrancing to any human being.  The stirring of our glowing orange pot represents the cosmic brew whence we all sprang.  Come contemplate this fermentation of civilization as we prepare for the artistic creations possible only when you ignite the Amanda Radar Range of 3,000 B.C.Mold Making: Thursday, 30th 10 AMBig Casting: Friday,31st, 5-8 PM
print_description: Not the biological kind!  The metalurgical kind! Come watch us create a witches brew of liquid metal!  We will do a molten "pour" in your presence!

description:
As always, Morphous & ShiZaru and the full international and domestic TBE crew are oh so ready, willing and able to facilitate the very best in bassquakin' as loud & proud as needed, to generate a veritble TSUNAMI deluge of freeBASSin' for all the denizens of Black Rock City. 

In addition to the high quality audio ~WaVeS~ TBE is well known for in their event enhancement production, once again TBE will be bringing their official theme camp (the TSUNAMI BASS EXPERIENCE), which will serve as the location for TBE's multi-media, interactive art/sound installation: the ~WaVe~2.0 to BRC!

This revolutionary interactive installation was conceived, designed and created by ShiZaru.zoe & Andrew Morphous specifically for the application of BASS CULTURE APPRECIATION and EDUTAINMENT. The first ~WaVe~ Ver. 1 prototype debuted in NYC in Feb 2011 at the Funhaus technology fair with subsequent indoor, outdoor and mobile versions appearing at various art and bass culture events during the spring and summer throughout in the NYC area including the LOST HORIZONS NIGHT MARKET and the FIGMENT NYC 2011 and 2012 art festival on Governor's Island. 
If you have had the TSUNAMI BASS EXPERIENCE, then you know how it LOOKS, SOUNDS, and FEELS... 

The ~WaVe~ installation is capable of transducing the low end frequencies as low as 5 Hz, provides a sensory enhancement oft described as a "bassface inducing," but more importantly, taps directly into one's kinestetic learning/thinking modality. It is this, when combined with the proper audio and visual ~WaVeS~ for expontential enahancement, that sparks the intuitive, thereby facilitating proper BASS CULTURE APPRECIATION. 

So come on by and take a dip in the deluge, challenge your perceptions on the Tsunami Bass Experience's ~WaVe~2.0, custom built 'Body~Sonic' dance platforms that will rumble ur rectum and sooth your heart/mind with oh so fine low end frequency via proper BASS!!
print_description: Challenge your perceptions on TBE's custom Body-Sonic ~WaVe~ installation, an experience that allows you to intuit proper bass culture like no other!
title: Wobble tha' ~WaVe~2.0 w/Tsunami Bass Experience!!

description:
Wait, we have to go a whole week without logging in to play computer games? Better believe by Saturday there’s a lot of us going to be jonesing for our fix. That doesn’t just apply to those of us in camp, there’s thousands of people out on the playa that will be getting the mouse-hand shakes by the weekend. Since popping up the laptop and logging on isn’t an option, we’ll just have ourselves an addiction party instead.

Open to all everyone, gamer or not, we’ll have a little gathering Saturday afternoon. Anyone who has completed our daily quests, or just wants to hang out and get their fix is welcome. Our resident mad alchemist has come up with some special brews, and servings of delicious chocolate cake are available to all. If any of our "Dragonbreath" chili remains, it’s a great time to polish that off. Hang out, drink some "kungaloosh", take down a "sulfuron slammer", and swap war stories of "How I wiped the 40 man raid".
print_description: Miss raiding?  Want to talk about your DPS?  Come discuss, and have some delicious chocolate cake!
title: WoW Addicts Recovery Meeting

description:
Indulge in this challenging, informative, spontaneous, and worshipful experience with Uma, celebrated by New York Magazine as one of NYC's top 5 fitness gurus. Open to all levels.
 
About Uma
 
A life-long belief of "to know it is to live it" found Uma at the doorstep of the famed NYC Jivamukti Yoga Studio of Sharon Gannon and David life. 1997's top grad turned teacher-training director, began to cultivate her roots. Saraswati's "serial chants" and "deft sermons" quickly soared globally as both U.S. and French edition Marie Claire magazines began to pick up on her message.
 
As the foremost Senior Advanced Certified Jivamukti Yoga Teacher, Saraswati mentored hundreds of students. Devotees and apprentices have gone on to open successful yoga studios nationwide.
 
Spiritual master, Shree Maa, initiated Uma into the ceremonial rites of puja worship. Her name Nanda Saraswati, The Goddess of Bliss, was then bestowed.
 
Through intense workshops and rehabilitative knowledge, Uma teaches the authentic experience of becoming your Self. In her pocket she carries a toolkit of ancient teachings: knowledge of Sanskrit language, performance of ceremonial worship, kirtan chanting (5-year tour with famed wallah bhagavan das), meditation, bhakti, and karma yoga studies. Over the years, Uma has had a host of long-standing, high profile, private clients.
 
Uma’s belief that you can't read life, you have to become life; moves you into the depths of your being, so you can peace out. 
 
When she is not teaching yoga in downtown NYC, she is ecstatically chanting the name of God in bliss-filled, rock the house, get up and dance kirtans with Lokah. Their debut album, The Ivy Ceiling, is a groundbreaking work that fuses their hearts, souls and voices in a collage of sound.  The album features the vocal gracings of Sting and a spoken word introduction by Russell Simmons.  Roderick and Anissa Romero of the Seattle underground band, Sky Cries Mary, are featured on backing vocals.
print_description: Indulge in this challenging, informative,& worshipful experience with Uma, named by New York Magazine as one of NYC's top 5 fitness gurus. Open to all
title: Yoga with Uma

description:
Camp Above The Limit is hosting an open mic Musicians' Happy Hour Monday thru Thursday from 4:00 pm till 8:00 pm with a grand performance on Saturday. 
We will have scheduled and ad hoc performances promoting musical diversity, radical self expression, participation, and entertainment. 

If you are a musician or performance artist and wish to play on the "You're The Limit Stage" bring yourself, your talent and your instrument to Camp Above The Limit and participate in our Musical Diversity Program! It doesn't matter what it is! From violin to kazoo, guitar to ocarina, banjo, sarod, sitar, Spanish bagpipes, heck even accordions are welcome. 

Bluegrass, Shamanic, Old Timey, Country, Rock, Classical, Irish, English, Morris Dancing, French, Middle Eastern, Balkan, Afghan, Indian, Barber Shop, or performance art. Whether it be your whole band or your radically self-expressive solo act, bring it! We will provide sound and we'll have other musicians for accompaniment: drums, guitar, mandolin, most likely anything you would need. We will be putting together an all-star performance on Saturday for all those who participate so come be a part of a great community of musicians and performance artists and share your gifts with us and the playa! Community is what makes the Burn so great and within all communities there is greatness! Come share yours with all of us!
print_description: Musicians' Happy Hour! Open mic, scheduled and ad hoc performances promoting musical diversity, radical self expression, and great entertainment!
title: You're The Limit Stage
